attributes.action: Preserve all existing rights of UK citizens to Freedom of Movement in the EU
attributes.background: The EU Referendum text did not instruct the Government to sign away UK citizens' current rights to travel, reside, work, study, or retire freely anywhere in the EU, without discrimination. Though on Brexit we lose EU citizenship, the Govt. has a duty to preserve our rights in its Brexit Agreement.
attributes.additional_details:
These Factsheets summarise your current rights of Free Movement 1) as EU citizens, & 2) via UK membership of the Single Market. You will lose these rights unless they are protected. 

1) Free Movement of Persons: (skip the Schengen section) http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_2.1.3.html 
2) Free Movement of Workers: (different emphasis: this is oriented to the Single Market): http://www.europarl.europa.eu/atyourservice/en/displayFtu.html?ftuId=FTU_3.1.3.html

attributes.action: DLA low rate mobility and standard rate pip mobility entitled to a free car
attributes.background: Everybody on mobility part PIP/DLA low rate should be entitled to a free car

attributes.action: Make it illegal to shoot rabbits in the UK.
attributes.background: My rabbit got shot by a farmer whilst it was out in the field whilst i watching him. And it could happen to a lot more people and if you have a pet rabbit it might get shot.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of kittens and puppies in pet shops
attributes.background: It is devastating to see that there are so many stray dogs and cats on the streets these days. Many are due to the fact that people go to pet stores, see an adorable little baby kitten or puppy and buy it on whim then further on down the line become bored and they end up in shelters up for adoption.
attributes.additional_details:
We can prevent this drastically if pet shops stop selling puppies and kittens. It will force people to go to the shelter and adopt an animal from there or make them think about it instead of buying them on impulse. Some pet shops won't vet the home it is going to, to make sure it's going to the best home possible.
We ask for urgent action to raise awareness & encourage the public to choose a responsibly bred puppy/kitten with history information, or adopt from a legitimate rescue organisation.

attributes.action: Build a minimum of 100,000 social/council houses per year
attributes.background: With immigration at over 300,000 per year for the last 15 years we do not have enough housing. Private landlords are taking over £9bn a year in housing benefit. This money should be spent on building social housing where low income persons can feel secure in a long term tenancy.
attributes.additional_details: The surge in HMO's - House of Multiple Occupancy and extortionate private rents is forcing people to live in poor conditions. Social housing with long term tenancies will help to create a better community where people can call their house a home. Private letting creates a transient community of people leaving and moving every few months and destabilises peoples lives for work, health care and general community cohesion.

attributes.action: take alcohol off display in shops like cigarettes and no advertising
attributes.background:
Alcohol-related crime in the UK is estimated to cost between £8bn and £13bn per year.
A fifth (29%) of all violent incidents in 2013–14 took place in or around a pub or club. ...
attributes.additional_details: There were 8,270 casualties of drink driving accidents in the UK in 2013, including 240 fatalities and 1,100 people who suffered serious injury.

attributes.action: Take care of our Homeless before  housing  20,000 Syrian Refugees
attributes.background: The Government have announced that local authorities have found enough properties to house 20,000 Syrian Refugees,
attributes.additional_details: This is disgusting we have homeless people including ex members of the armed forces who have fought for this country who have nowhere to live and yet they want to home people from abroad who have never paid anything into the system getting not only free houses but no doubt benefits that we pay for as well

attributes.action: Please sign the petition for the Robin to become our official National Bird.
attributes.background: This petition is being co-ordinated by David Lindo - also known as The Urban Birder - a natural history broadcaster and writer. He would like to start a petition to get this fantastic little bird, so relevent to to the British way of life, officially recognised as our National Bird.
attributes.additional_details:
Britain's Vote National Bird Campaign was a two part vote. The first leg was launched in August 2014. Thereafter, a shortlist of 10 species was created and went to the general public to vote. This second leg of the campaign started in March 2015 and ended at midnight on May 6th 2015 - General Election Day.

The Robin won!!

The full campaign story can be found here: http://www.votenationalbird.com

and here: 
https://bulletprblog.wordpress.com/2015/06/23/britains-vote-national-bird-campaign/

attributes.action: Ensure fair pricing for those with worse eyesight.
attributes.background: Glass lens thickness is based on prescription strength. People with poor eyesight are limited, and must suffer (physically) from wearing heavier lenses. Vendors in the UK sell thinner lenses for a substantial premium (over £100). This pricing should be voided so glasses costs are fair for all.

attributes.action: The import and personal use of DMT-containing plant materials should be legal.
attributes.background: While the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016 is right to ban some dangerous legal highs, a blanket ban is ill-considered. Personal use and import of DMT-containing plant materials, in their natural form, should be legal, especially since the possession of said item is NOT a crime under this new act.
attributes.additional_details:
Certain plants and plant materials found in nature have long been used for curing depression, learning about consciousness and developing spirituality for those who find religion ineffective. Plants used for 'Ayahuasca' have powerful healing properties and have been used by many to help overcome depression, anxiety and stress. Personal use can allow people to study spirituality, the nature of our existence and consciousness as a right of their freedom.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayahuasca

attributes.action: Make it law that all members of Parliament take regular drug and alcohol tests.
attributes.background: The government are accountable to the people and as most companies now test for drugs and alcohol so should Parliament as they shouldn't be running as ministers if under the influence

attributes.action: Return Tier 1 Skilled Migrant visa for professionals of shortage occupation list
attributes.background: Currently there is a shortage occupation list which is well documented. Regardless of this shortage occupation list, the complex process for Tier 2 visa is a deterrent for companies to recruit even the perfect professional candidate from outside of the EU. UK thus loses the best to other EU nations!
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/486107/Shortage_Occupation_List_-_November_2015.pdf

attributes.action: Provide statistical report of areas / numbers of culled badgers hosting TB.
attributes.background: The Government failed to test culled badgers to measure the percentage hosting tuberculosis & the most affected areas.  This data is key. UK Government ignored advice of Wildlife Experts by continuing the Badger cull. Other wildlife such as Deer host TB, so the badger cull policy is flawed.
attributes.additional_details: Despite all efforts by wildlife experts to stop the badger cull the Government continues with a badly devised scheme to reduce TB.  The most important data was never obtained. Recording the number of affected culled badgers and the areas where TB was most prevalent is surely crucial for developing a strategy to reduce Bovine TB.  A statistical report will show where number of TB hosts are more severe.  Joined up interventions such as vaccinations and bio-security on farms are needed.

attributes.action: Ban the Prime Minister and Cabinet from receiving cash in exchange for meetings
attributes.background: Prime Minister Theresa May is selling lunch meetings with herself at her 2016 party conference for £3,150.
attributes.additional_details:
See reports in the Guardian https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2016/sep/02/theresa-may-3150-lunch-democracy-for-sale-lobbyists?CMP=fb_gu 

and the
Telegraph http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/09/01/business-leaders-charged-3000-a-head-to-have-lunch-with-theresa/

attributes.action: Remove from doctors working within the NHS the right to strike.
attributes.background: I am a patient with two incurable deteriorating brain conditions. I have waited for six months for three appointments all of which are likely to be cancelled. I have followed the negotiations  closely and have very reluctantly come to the conclusion that the BMA  are being highly irresponsible.
attributes.additional_details:
Three reasons:
1) In May of this year the BMA representative described the new contract as a deal "All sides can sign up to" and that "Doctors can be confident in this new contract". They now say the contract is so bad there have to be massive damaging strikes.
2)There has been a large drop in support for the BMA's militant stance. Of the 54,000 members only a minority 21540 voted to reject the new contract. This is down from 98% at the start of the dispute. A responsible union would re-ballot its members.
3) The BMA have consistently refused to take action such as legal action which would not damage patients and would win their dispute.

attributes.action: Change The General Election Voting System From FPTP To Instant-Runoff Voting
attributes.background: Hello, I am Emmanuel and I am 13 years old and came across a video on YouTube that displayed how bad the first past the post voting system is. In its simplest form FPTP is basically winner takes all. In the general election the Conservatives won 36.9% of the votes but they have 100% of the power.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to change the the the general election voting system from FPTP to IRV because in IRV there is definitely a majority winner so most people who vote will at least be moderately happy.

This YouTube video explains how bad FPTP is: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s7tWHJfhiyo

This YouTube video explains how much better IRV is: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Y3jE3B8HsE

attributes.action: Allow workers to continue to sacrifice their salaries in exchange for safer cars
attributes.background: The Daily Mail have reported today that "The Treasury’s proposed rules could come into force next April and would effectively kill off tax benefits worth thousands of pounds a year for company car drivers. Under the plans, workers would be taxed . . ."
attributes.additional_details: Salary sacrifice schemes are the only way some people would ever be able to drive a nice car - you see far fewer "old bangers" on the road nowadays. These schemes must be hugely beneficial to car manufacturers and all associated industries.

attributes.action: Suspend wage reviews for senior civil servants until after brexit negotiations
attributes.background: Civil servants shouldn't need motivating to do their job of backing British interests but unfortunately they have been so intermingled with the EU for so long. They could be inclined to drag thing's out hoping for a new Pro EU government or a second referendum.
attributes.additional_details: So I suggest halting all senior service pay a promotion reviews until after the brexit process has been completed with a cut off date of 2019 a full year before the next generation election. Then the retrospective senior service reviews will be based on past brexit performance not a half hearted effort of the reluctant

attributes.action: Anti Flash Hoods to be Mandatory Under SOLAS Regs
attributes.background: Ammend SOLAS Regulations to make the issue of Anti Flash Hoods a mandatory requirement as part of ships fire fighting equipment

attributes.action: help with more funding for veterans with PTSD and family's
attributes.background: Currently change step have been denied extra funding to carry on providing a mentoring service for veterans suffering PTSD and families, by losing this much needed service, this could have a negative impact on the mental health issues of veterans,
attributes.additional_details:
Change Step, based in Colwyn Bay, Conwy county, said 29 workers would lose their jobs following an unsuccessful bid for further funding.
The charity said it was still "determined to carry on".
The Ministry of Defence, which awarded the charity £995,918 in 2013, said it could apply for further funding "in the coming months and years".

attributes.action: An annual National Sports Day to grow participation in sport & physical activity
attributes.background: One day a year should be designated a National Sports Day (#sportsday). Saturday 27th August 2016 saw the #IAmTeamGB campaign hold free events around the country to encourage people to participate in sport and physical activity. This should become a government supported annual national event.
attributes.additional_details:
In December 2015 Tracey Crouch MP Minister for Sport, Tourism and Heritage launched 'Sporting Future: A New Strategy for an Active Nation', encouraging sport and physical activity as a national priority. Shortly after, Jennie Price Chief Executive, Sport England launched the new 2016-2021 strategy 'Sport England: Towards An Active Nation'.

We need an annual National Sports Day to bring these strategies to life and to capitalise on Team GB & Paralympics GB's potential to inspire the nation.

attributes.action: Implement a detection system to stop parental abduction of children leaving U.K
attributes.background: The government needs to implement a no nonsense approach to stopping one parent abducting a child to another country at Airports and all points of travel especially holiday seasons. Systems as such already exist in Canada, US and even in the Middle East.
attributes.additional_details:
Government needs to make sure kids cannot leave from the U.K without the consent of both parents 
"Nobody asked if he had my permission to take her" 
Sarah Taylor Rise in parental child abductions 
Foreign Office figures that show that the number of British children abducted by a parent and taken overseas has increased in the past year. 
A mother's lengthy search for her kidnapped child-http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk

attributes.action: Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016.
attributes.background:
Repeal the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016. Legal highs have been around for 20 years until the unsubstantiated hype of dangers.

We are in an era where countries are criminalising drugs and with this act the UK has gone backwards because of unsubstantiated hype.
attributes.additional_details:
We now know that former legal highs are available illegally and have become more dangerous. The industry still exists. It is wasting police time and resources when we should be focusing on terror and more important matters. Even the UN says drugs should be decriminalised.

UK Parliament has made more people into criminals when it is supposed to be criminal justice reform. The Equalities Commission & the PM said coloured people are more likely to go to jail this is racist legislation.

attributes.action: Ban all HGVs from the third lane of all motorways
attributes.background: Motorway expansion was meant to increase traffic flow but, with lorries using lanes 1 2 and 3, traffic bunches up causing congestion

attributes.action: Consolidate mobile telephone infrastructure networks under one umbrella company
attributes.background: Many of us consumers choose a mobile provider based on coverage in the areas where we live and work. But when we travel we often find connectivity is poor (or non-existent) in certain areas if we are customers of the wrong provider.
attributes.additional_details: If the network infrastructure were to become owned by one umbrella company, then we could have excellent coverage no matter with which provider we were customers. The providers would then have a similar business relationship with the umbrella company as train operators have with Network Rail, or broadband providers have with BT Openreach. In attracting customers, providers could no longer rely on coverage, but would need to find innovative ways to be competitive.

attributes.action: Make legal, individual to be in possession and smoke small quantity of cannabis
attributes.background: Cannabis is an illegal drug throughout the UK, although there may be scientific evidence to prove that it may be harmful but isn't it an individual's right to make that decision whether is be harmful to themselves or not. It should be legal for small quantity but not enough for distribution
attributes.additional_details: It provides medical benefits that some prescription drugs cannot

attributes.action: Remove the charge for calling 101 non police emergency.
attributes.background: We shouldn't be charged 15 pence for calling 101, when calling 999 is free.

attributes.action: Remove the Insurance Premium Tax
attributes.background: A tax known as IPT (Insurance Premium Tax) was added to all insurance policies by the last government and was originally levied at 6%. Recently this has risen to 9% and due to become 10% in October 2016.
attributes.additional_details: On a £500 insurance policy this adds a tax (for the privilege of taking out a policy, be it house insurance, car insurance, holiday insurance and pet insurance) of £50 to your Policy  and pro rata according to the amount you pay for your Policy. This is a statutory amount payable on EVERY policy you take out and so you are paying this tax on every Policy you have. You are not paying once, but a number of times. The IPT compulsory charge is making insurance policies unaffordable and is yet another `hidden` tax which is making us all poorer. Please sign the Petition to have IPT removed.

attributes.action: Introduction of Mental Health into National Curriculum and Hospitals
attributes.background:
We truly believe that more needs to be done in relation to suicide.

There should be no stigma attached to Mental Health and the only way to eradicate a stigma surrounding a 'taboo' subject is to educate by bringing it into National Curriculum and more information/care available in hospitals.
attributes.additional_details:
6581 committed suicide in 2014 alone, each and everyone of those people had a family, friends and countless people that would have been touched by their passing.
We passionately believe that the rates of suicide would decrease if Mental Health was part of the National Curriculum and the younger generation were aware of what symptoms to look out for in themselves and those around them
With that we also believe that there's room for improvement with information and Mental Health care in hospitals

attributes.action: An NHS research investment donation app for mobile phones and computers.
attributes.background: Well I have ulcerative colitis and every time I go to hospital I notice there are a lot of people who would like to be able to do more and feel as if they can do nothing at least with a app people can send money to invest in research in areas where they would like to see improvements in research.
attributes.additional_details: I don't feel evidence is something needed in this case. Good people invest in good things and this is one of them.

attributes.action: Address the rise in incidences of dangerous driving on UK roads.
attributes.background: There is a lack of deterrent for dangerous drivers on UK roads. Speeding, illegal manoeuvring and blatant disregard for the Highway Code seem to have become common-place. The UK needs to rethink it's reliance on speed cameras, speed humps, etc. and begin enforcing speed and dangerous driving laws.

attributes.action: Stop cataract eye operations being rationed for the elderly ..
attributes.background: it is a fact that hospitals are restricting people from having cataract operations, to save money,  yet they only cost £800-00 and take about 30 mins. A lot of them would pay the £800-00  to help with the cost ,but cant afford around £3000-00.

attributes.action: "Parliamentary privilege" must not be used to keep members above the law
attributes.background: Despite having been jailed for fiddling expenses in 2011, a new CPS case of false accounting against sitting Tory peer Lord Hannigfield recently collapsed when Justice McCreath ruled he couldn’t be prosecuted for falsely claiming attendance allowance – on the grounds of “parliamentary privilege”!
attributes.additional_details:
This taints the reputation of both Houses, makes a mockery of reforms following the "expenses" scandal and sets the dangerous precedent of placing parliamentarians' expenses beyond public scrutiny or prosecution.

Therefore, we call on both Houses to debate and reform the practical application of "parliamentary privilege" in cases of prosecutable false accounting or fraud. Also, along with this, members subsequently convicted in the courts should automatically be deprived of their seats/titles.

attributes.action: Implement driving evaluations to make UK roads safer
attributes.background: Driving evaluations should become a regular requirement in the UK. By introducing a standard driving evaluation every 5 years (approx.) to deem drivers 'safe to drive', road fatalities and casualties should decrease, and the overall safety level of the roads should improve.
attributes.additional_details:
There was a recorded 24,610 people killed or seriously injured in car accidents between 1st April 2015 - 31st March 2016.

Motor traffic levels have increased 1.8% in the rolling year. It is important to ensure road safety is at the highest levels.

https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/543662/quarterly-estimates-january-to-march-2016.pdf

attributes.action: Stop BBC Threats to Spy on all WiFi Connections, make iplayer Password Protected
attributes.background:
On 01/09/16 paying TV licence free is required to watch iplayer.

To enforce this BBC claim they've developed new WiFi snooping detector vans, to packet sniff all WiFi connections to see if iplayer is being used.

This is a gross invasion of privacy.  Not wanting to watch the BBC is not a crime!
attributes.additional_details:
The BBC already have access to the information of who is watching iplayer.  When someone watches their IP address is logged on the BBC server, which uniquely identifies which internet connection has been using it. 

The BBC have the option to make the iplayer password protected, much like Netflix or Amazon Prime.  This password could be associated with a TV licence, so only licence payers can use the service.

Detection vans are an unnecessary invasion of privacy & waste of licence payers money.

attributes.action: Allow fathers to stay with poorly babies in hospitals
attributes.background: on 3rd August 2016 my 4 day old daughter was rushed to hospital because she wasn't breathing properly, once we were seen we were sent to a ward, where I (Father) was told I had to leave her and go home because the ward was for women.
attributes.additional_details: I was forced to leave my baby in the hospital because they ward staff would not allow me to stay with her. I believe men should be allowed to stay with their children regardless!

attributes.action: Ensure restaurant/food seller menus list any present allergens in their food
attributes.background: In many restaurants it is difficult to know if an allergen is present in the food being served. Allergy sufferers should be able to see what is going into their food, as they can on supermarket packaging. A menu with a full list of ingredients should therefore be available if required.

attributes.action: Prevent motorway central reservation grass cutting
attributes.background: The cost in time and lost commerce is immense and so un-necessary, it's naturally sown wild grasses and flowers (and helps prevent glare at night from headlamps on the opposite carriageway). Three times this week I have been delayed by these works totalling 3 hours in delays.

attributes.action: Ban political nominations for the Queens honours list
attributes.background: The curry system has been brought into disrepute by David Cameron.

attributes.action: Stop the creation of retirement honours and dissolution honours.
attributes.background: Using these honours to reward friends and party backers brings the whole honours system into disrepute.

attributes.action: Make GCSE Food Technology compulsory
attributes.background: Im a food lover and blogger and I want to make a change. I have loved food ever since I watched a Jamie Oliver christmas special back in 2006. My love for food and specifically helping younger people have grown over the years and now I want to kick up a fuss and make GCSE Food Technology compulsory
attributes.additional_details: The number of children taking Food Technology at GCSE is dropping. Too many kids nowadays are growing up not knowing how about food, with around 2 million children growing up with just one parent-it is questionable that mums and dads just don't have the time to teach their children how to cook/bake. The Department of Education quite clearly is TOO focused on wanting the children of the future to grow up to become more academic.

attributes.action: Stronger convictions on burglaries
attributes.background: Too many criminals get away with burglary and many continue to reoffend. Preventing burglary is not enough, we need tougher sentences to reduce the amount of offences.
attributes.additional_details: The worst crime against working people is what we have earned and worked hard for is taken away from us.

attributes.action: Companies get tax benefits to sell recycled tech or parts rather than new tech
attributes.background: Every year, millions of tons of operational tech is thrown away. For example in Europe, the average phone is used for 1.5yrs before being swapped, but most actually last ~6yrs. If the tax system were changed, companies would be encouraged to promote reuse or recycling of old technology.
attributes.additional_details:
See
http://www.electronicstakeback.com/wp-content/uploads/Facts-and-Figures-on-E-Waste-and-Recycling.pdf

attributes.action: Make changes to the Dartford crossing procedure.
attributes.background: When using the Dartford river crossing there are signs telling drivers when and how to pay but these are easily missed. I propose that they either bring back the tolls or send a letter to drivers telling them when and how to pay.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence for a company to keep quiet about a security breach.
attributes.background: If a company does not immediately inform customers of a data breach concerning their account details, that company is aiding and abetting criminal activity (the stealing of customers money and identities).
attributes.additional_details:
Individuals have a right to be told immediately if their details have been compromised, and where the company has been negligent customers have a right to be compensated. 

Introduce a law making it a criminal offence for a company to not immediately inform customers of any breach of security that may have compromised customers' personal information (identity) or payment card details.

attributes.action: Levy £1.00 tax on non recyclable coffee cups and give proceeds to NHS.
attributes.background: Britain throws away 2 500 000 000 coffee cups a year which cannot be recycled. The technology exists to make them recyclable. This tax will make it an economic necessity for the BIG coffee companies to act.
attributes.additional_details: Reference BBC1 program presented by Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall "War on waste" 21:00 July 28 2016.

attributes.action: Force bars, restaurants and nightclubs to sell more varieties of diet drinks
attributes.background: Despite an apparent obesity crisis in the UK and more people being diagnosed with diabetes, drinking establishments don't sell enough diet drinks. These venues should be forced to sell the diet variety of any soft drink they sell, to improve peoples health and wellbeing.

attributes.action: Employers should pay for staff to get home safe if they work past midnight
attributes.background: Employers should be held responsible for making sure their staff get home safe when working late shifts, especially young staff working in city centres. Hospitality staff in particular work late hours in at risk areas  & shouldn't be put in positions which make them vulnerable to attack.
attributes.additional_details: Working in hospitality for the last 6 years I've seen people been put at risk on their way home from work. Due to the nature of the job, working hours and the social climate within our city centres walking home alone can be threatening and potentially dangerous . Employers should value and take a degree of responsibility for the fact that their employees are looked after at all times - this shouldn't end at the door of work.

attributes.action: Abolish the Early Years Teacher Status
attributes.background: The Early Years Teacher Status was introduced in an attempt to provide children in the Early Years with specialist practitioners. These specialists would be responsible for providing high-quality early education, something many lower qualified practitioners already do on a daily basis.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst the EYTS qualifies a practitioner as an Early Years teacher, it does not align itself to QTS and the pay of a teacher with QTS. Therefore, many holders of EYTS are paid substianirslly less than teachers and their are very limited opportunities. Many schools will opt for a holder of QTS than EYTS. In addition, due to, a lack of clarity many nurseries are unsure of the role, the qualification and the rate of pay meaning some Early Years Teschers are paid minimum wage.

attributes.action: The UK to leave the EU Single Market by the end of 2016
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM government to respect the democratic will of the people and as such, make immediate arrangements for the UK to completely withdraw from the EU Single Market by no later than the end of 2016.
